review: We Love eating here at the Rosedale Hwy Chili's! We eat here at least one night a week.  The food is good.  We LOVE the 3 for $10  special that they run periodically. If that is not available, then we usually order the steakhouse combo or the faitas.  The chicken breast in the steakhouse combo is cooked correctly every time.  It is so moist & never dry. And the endless chips are great. They even stay fresh in the take home bag.  And the staff is great. The red headed hostess, that is now blond, knows us by name & always recalls the area that we like to sit. And  the waiter (John) is quick on his feet & keeps an eye out for the almost empty glasses.  Thank you staff for  always making it an enjoyable evening out! Annette & Phillip

Unfortunately it's just really subpar. Everything was mediocre, from the tableside guacamole, which was unsalted and lacking flavor, to the margarita, which was so watered down you couldn't even tell it was strawberry, to the steak enchiladas, which were greasy and made with poor quality meat, to the burgers, which had far too much bread for the meat. I wouldn't come here again. Ever.

Chili's is just not a restaurant I would frequent. It's loud and the food is mediocre. We went because it was a family gathering and we had no choice. This is the second time we have been to a Chili's and both times we were disappointed. Here the service was good and although the server was obviously new he did a good job and will be an asset to the restaurant. Donna had the chicken fajitas and I had the sirloin leather steak. No seasoning on my steak and cut like an old shoe.

I don't ever typically have good luck when it comes to Chili's, but at this location I've had nothing but the best service and best tasting food the past handful of times. I am typically a "picky eater", but this location gets it just right every time. Also, the staff is GREAT and the service is speedy. I love the bar area at this particular location. They always have a full staff, the food comes out hot and exactly how I wanted it , the drinks are great and the manager personally approached us today to ensure our visit wasn't anything less than extraordinary. If you're going to go to any Chili's , I highly recommend this location over the Gosford location any and every day!

Ok, update to my last review.  My kids wanted Chili's, so I gave in.  I must say, service has improved significantly since my last couple visits.  The menu was revamped and probably the training the servers received, because, service was on par today--quite impressed.   I was able to add myself on the waitlist through Yelp.  I like that feature.  Our waitress, Lauren, was pretty attentive.  The food was good too.  First time I tried the Chili at Chili's--it was good but not the best.  It was more soupy like rather than thick and meaty.  I tried the Caribbean Salad and I actually like it.  They cut fresh pineapple which was a nice touch to the salad.  First time I tried the guacamole with the chips and salsa and I liked it. It had big chunks of Avocado, which I actually like it that way. I do like how you can pay on the electronic thingamajig.  Very convenient!  I can tell the staff worked well together and as a team.

I love chili's! Normally I always get the original queso and nachos. This last time my boyfriend and I tried the meat platter and had queso and egg rolls. The egg rolls are always amazing and of course the queso. The meat platter I didn't care for but my boyfriend liked it. It was $17.99 for a 3 choice meat platter and my boyfriend wanted ribs so it was an extra $2. To me it wasn't worth it but he liked it. We got crispy chicken( which was good with buffalo sauce I ordered), jalapeño sausage (I didn't care for it at all) and ribs (boyfriend wanted to try them since everyone says chili's ribs are good). Bill came out to $37 which wasn't too bad for all the food and leftovers for his lunch the next day!

There is always a wait.... it's Chili's... come on there's a ton of tables.  But my favorite is being told that "We are transitioning from our lunch to our dinner service and so it's going to be a fifteen minute wait."  There were so many tables open.  It's no one's fault but your own if you can't organize a transition to a different menu.

Chili's is a good place just to go quickly after shopping at target. Food is inexpensive and food comes out fairly fast. You can spend $22 on a dinner for 2! You can't do that in most places. Servers are friendly and helpful bartenders was attentive. Would definitely come back!

Excellent service today. Checked in over the phone only had to wait five minutes while they set up the table. Waitress came right over we ordered drinks and an appetizer. Our chips and salsa came out fast then our drinks. Refills came out before we asked. Our service and food was awesome.

The waiter was pretty good and the food came reasonably quick but the only thing wrong is that they kicked somebody that I know out of a booth and they were just sitting down but they did get another booth after waiting about 20 min but overall I give this yelp review4 stars only because of the kicking out but the waiter was nice and helped a lot  aka she is a snake
We sat in the bar today and Sydney was our server. She was very attentive and courteous. Always asking to get us another drink or more water.    A very enjoyable afternoon. Thank you Sydney!

I got the avocado grilled chicken sandwich a couple days ago and it was delicious. I never thought too much about chili's, but this sandwich changed my mind. So good! My boyfriend got the chicken and waffles, and those were also really good.

I enjoy Chili's and always have trouble in deciding what to eat. Usually I always order the same thing when I go out to eat because I know what I like. Here though, I get pasta, steak, burgers, or even salad. They used to have really good potato skins but they've changed the menu since and now have Texas cheese fries which are pretty good.  Regarding the service, it seems to be getting better. Today we were seated next to a very loud group of people and without us even asking the hostess asked us if we would like to sit somewhere else.

I decided to take my mother out to eat and we had a bad experience. We received our silverware and i had a piece of food still stuck to my fork. My mother ordered GRILLED CHICKEN FAJITAS and the chicken nor the onions and bell peppers were grilled. Also the wooden plate they served on the bottom of the hot plate was dirty and had old food stains on it. The onions smelled spoiled. I order the 6 oz sirloin and asked for it to be extra well done and it was still pink. And my steak tasted like a hamburger patty. We approach the waitress about the problem but instead of her apologizing she said " i was not the person serving you guys, and im waitress not a dishwasher.

I have come to Chili's again for another great meal, and they didn't disappoint! I got their new Chipotle Honey Chicken and Waffles, and I recommend this meal for everyone who wants some good chicken. Our waitress, Karen, got us everything we needed. The chips and fries were good as always. I would come here everyday if I could!
Great food, great service, awesome drinks! Fun place for a date night or to hang out with friends! You will love the lively atmosphere and tasty food. Desserts good too

Our favorite Chili's! Service is almost prompt, efficient and on point! I really like how we are able to enjoy our meal without being asked every 5 minutes how we're doing, yet still be checked up on regularly! We have yet to have a "bad" experience! Thanks y'all for the awesome service!

Good food but here is a scary thought.  Have you ever noticed how they leave the water pitcher alone. Anyone could walk by it and put stuff in the water.  Many people walk passed that.  Something to think about.

Came here today to have a date with my daughter . Service started out great . I had a coupon for a free dessert and wanted to use it. I had told the waiter so he could take it off my bill . I start wanting to pay my bill on the kiosk but it wasn't working. On the kiosk my total was 17$ when he brought me a receipt it wasn't itemized it just said 25.00. I then call over a different waiter and ask for an itemized receipt . Then I noticed he was billing me for the dessert even though I said it was my birthday. Felt like he was being somewhat dishonest with me by not bringing me an itemized total. Leads me to believe that when I left he was going to take off the dessert and take the 7$ on top of what ever tip I was giving . Anyways my tip to you is ask for an itemized receipt . Looks like I can't trust chilis anymore.

Ordered take out a couple of days ago. Was helped by Heather over the phone. She is so pleasant and articulate. They definitely picked the best person to be working the phones. Repeated my order back and even showed me what was inside the containers prior to leaving the restaurant to make sure my order was complete. The Texas rub ribs were super tasty.  I will be back!!!

Not happy with dinner .. Sat at the bar had a margarita while we waited for our TOGO order... I ordered a Triple dipper Chkn crispers , mouth bites and egg rolls ... Crispers looked old and tasted old .. Everything tastes like it had been sitting for a while !! My husband steak was very rare  I specifically asked for ranch and bbq sauce with my order.  I got one ranch no bbq..  when we received our order I asked if the ranch and bbq was in my bag ... bartender said yes! I'm giving them  two stars only because our drinks and my husbands ribs were good... While at the bar we were treated good and received good service so expected a good dinner tipping her well over 20 % ... If I would have looked at my order before I left my tip would have been a LOT smaller !!!

Good fish tacos.  Good Southwestern Eggrolls.  Good burgers.  Great in-house made pickles!  They were the deciding factor in where to eat.  The food, overall, is consistently decent. The service could use some work.  The servers are friendly enough, but with 3 servers per table, we spent as much time saying we were 'fine' as we did eating. Only one of the servers had a key card for the computer, and there is no cash register, so paying in cash proved to take a long time.  The service model just didn't make sense to me, and seemed to be more annoying than convenient, through no fault of the servers themselves.

It always seems to be busy here.  I like Chili's fine.  One of the more consistent chain restaurants out there.  The 2 for $20 dinner special is a good deal.  It includes one appetizer to share with your partner and two entrees.   Some Notes from our latest visit: The Cinnamon Molten cake ($6.89) is pretty good.  (3 stars) The Chocolate Cookie Skillet ($5.99) is terrific.  (4.5 stars) Mix & Match Fajita Trio ($15.39) is good.  (3 stars) 1/2 rack ribs with side ($10.79) is good.  (3 stars) Service was friendly and attentive at the bar area. (4 stars) The atmosphere was cool at the bar area with all the sports programs. (3.5 stars) I really enjoy going to Chili's once in awhile (especially when we have a gift card!!)  Have not had a bad experience yet.  If you get one of their specials, then you can really save money.  If you join their e-mail club, then they will send you coupons or deals almost every week.   Make sure to save room for dessert when you come here.  For me, it is the best part of the meal at Chili's!!

Haven't eaten here in over a year! Place looks like it improved on appearance which is good. More modern looking. The menus also changed a bit. Some previous items before aren't there anymore. Quite a bit of improvement.  Packed in a Sunday which I'm not surprised but for a 15-20 minute wait it wasn't bad.  We waited at the other 2 benches in between the first and second door and boy do they need some air in there. It's pretty stuffy waiting in that area.  Got sat and our waitress was pretty attentive. Looked like she wasn't happy at first but as time went on she seemed like she got better.  So here's our order: Drinks - 2 Arnold palmers one strawberry and one with mango (btw mango is so bomb!) Appetizer- triple dipper samplers (spring rolls, boneless bbq chicken and the mini burgers) all were pretty tasty! Main course - Crispy crispers: came with chicken strips corn & fries.  It was pretty much mediocre. They could have added a     bit more flavor or seasoning on the chicken. It was kind of bland.  Sweet & smokey burger: burger was pretty good according to my boyfriend. It was just perfect the way it was.  Overall, everything was pretty good. Our service wasn't that bad and food was mediocre on my part but I'll make sure to have some burgers the next time I visit.

My family and I ate here on Monday February 15 2016 and out server Vicky was amazing everything came out in a timely manner and never had to ask for refills she was on point with everything it made our experience great thank you again Vicky   The Turners

Upon arrival greeted and seated in less than 3 mins.  I noticed the bartenders were very friendly and smiling. Great impression. The waitstaff were very attentive to their tables. And mine was no exception. Destiny was very personablean d made suggestions.  I chose loaded baked potato soupEXCELLENT FLAVOR! The best I've had ever. I ordered bottomless chips with salsa and guac. The chips are thin and crisp. FRESH! The salsa fresh with chipoltle seasoning. NICE. Guacamole made at your table if you request the TABLESIDE guacamole.  For those who were not aware, this location is their training location for California's Central area. It's very busy (but with plenty of seating) and from what I observed at 9:20 pm on a Thursday night, people love to eat here. I was surprised by their star rating. Don't be fooled. It could be that their really great service is not being reported by their loyal fans or satisfied patrons. I suggest to give this location a try.
Service is always nice. DO NOT order the Peach Margarita. To sweet slurping nothing but sugar not worth the 9.

We're here at Chili's and I fired up Yelp just to tell ya how dang delicious the carnitas tacos are. Seriously good eats. We also ordered the enchilada soup (it's ok), fish taco, and shrimp taco. Those tacos were good, but the carnitas taco was out of this world. The service was good. We sat at the bar and the bar tender was quick with refills and food delivery. Very sweet hostess named Sky gave us a nice welcome.  Restrooms and eating area were clean and it was a nice atmosphere. Would recommend for a drink with friends, casual date night, or dinner with family. Not for a fancy dinner date.

Went for lunch on a Thursday. Service was poor; no one was rude, just perfunctory. Salad dishes left on table after other food served. No one checked back till we were almost through. Expediter stopped back to ask if all was alright, and before my wife could respond she said "good" and left. I had the new double cheese burger, "New" fresco salad, fries. Fries good. That's all. "Fresco salad" = some leaves, vinaigrette, crumbled queso fresco (cheap cheap cheap)  Burger was deplorable. Meat patties exact flavor of McDonalds- I would bet they are supplied from same processing plant. Cooked dry and hard. Served on a dry bready bun with re hardened cheese, some lettuce and mustard. The whole experience smacks of a restaurant cutting corners as they dive bomb out of business. I will never go to another chilis.

Really gotten bad here. Used to love the grilled chicken Caesar but the last few times they (kitchen) forget to put my dressing on the side.  And this time instead of the fresh grated Parmesan cheese it was the pizza topping Parmesan cheese covering the salad.  Meh.   Burgers are still pretty solid and juicy though.

I don't recommend getting the guacamole and chips. When you look at the menu it says the ingredients that are in the guacamole. But when the guacamole came they were not in it. It was just an avocado.

Great service, and probably the best turkey club sandwich I've ever had! My wife had the salmon and she loved it. Dane our server, took really good care of us and helped the kids stay patient by providing them with games. Definitely will be coming back to eat here!
Good food and service, didn't care for having the tablet to pay or to have it on the table but was good.
Good dinner.   Service isn't super quick, but the food was good.   The 2 for $20 is a great deal and left room for the very rich toffee brownie.

Short and sweet - I come here for a nice cocktail at extended hours and go-to appetizers. This usually is a margarita of some sort (can't go wrong with them here) and some sort of quesadilla-related food. Every time I've come to this location, I'm greeted with great service. Great place for a casual night!

5:00 P.M. Dinner time. We enter and are told our wait would be 15-20 minutes, acceptable in most cases but half the tables are empty.  Scanning the restaurant, it is obvious no one has any food in front of them.  A disgruntled couple leave there table and walk out.  Our name is now call to be seated, 5:20 p.m., still nobody has any food on their tables.  When I express concern about this to the hostess she offers no explanation and says she is sorry as we walk out.  This used to be a favorite place for a QUICK dinner, but something has definitely changed at this location!  You promote all your cool apps and express pay options but have suffered in service and efficiency.  Lately we take the longer drive down to the location on Gosford, nicer waiting area (when waiting is necessary) and better service.

Not happy about this place. The menus were discussing. Mine and my spouses were all sticky on every single page. I had to go wash my hands after touching them. We were seated fast but it took 20 mins to get water and a strawberry lemonade and a whole hour to get our apps and food. Bottom of the cups looks unclean. There was a dead earwig bug and even after we brought it to the waiter attention she didn't care.  I think they need to get the health department check redone. Never going here again.

It's Christmas Eve at Chili's. Sure, I expect things won't be business as usual. But don't substitute items without asking and act like it's completely normal. My child ordered the cheese pizza kids meal. They brought out something on the order of a burned cheese covered tortilla and didn't say anything until I said something. Really? You can't just say you ran out so we can order something else? Not a great way to serve the public. Disappointed.

The best Chili's bar we've been to! It was on our way to Vegas and we just needed a quick lunch; came in to this Chili and the hostess immediately greeted us with a smile. We decided to sit at the bar area because we heard laughers from there. We sat down and the bartender came to greet us with bright smile and offered us drink and food menus; she was very nice, friendly, funny, down to earth and making everyone at the bar very happy and comfortable. All 4 stars goes to the female bartender! Food was just alright since it's... Chili's.
Enchiladas are delicious! Service is ok. I suggest you call ahead and make a reservation unless you want to wait on a weekend when it is super busy.

Oh Chili how I once loved you..  now I want a divorce..  After many visits and what appears to be a consistent decline in quality food products, increased prices, and smaller portions, I just cant take it anymore.  My bill is never less than $50 and every time I leave I just feel ripped off.  The straw that finally broke the camels back was on our last visit.  Service was horrible, food took forever to come out to our table, and once it arrived it was just blah..  Hamburger was blah.. Chicken quesadilla was just blah..  Kids chicken strips was just blah...  Even the skillet queso that used to be filled with nice chunks of mystery meat was just blah... Blah Blah Blah..  Please stop sending me those tempting emails with pictures of fantastic food just to serve me blah..  Blah..  Its over chilis..
Ok service. Overheard/saw owner talking to a female employee in an disrespectful way which always ruins an experience. Typical Chili's food.

Went in on 11/22 and was told it was a 10-15 minute wait. The place was busy however it maybe took about 5 minutes to get seated. My sister and I ordered a Michelada with Modelo. Worst Michelada I have ever had. It just did not taste good at all and had me cringing and neither my sister or I could even finish them. I make better micheladas at home and that's saying a lot for a white girl. Waited 45 min for our appetizers alone and then another 15 minutes for our food. My sister and I ordered the Cajun shrimp pasta. The meal itself was good, the bread left something to be desired though. We usually wait to get the check from the waitress but after waiting so long for everything else I was not going to wait 20 minutes for the waitress to appear again so I paid by the little machine on the table which was so much faster and easier.

Kids happy with there food service great my food was good didn't stand out though I will be back though just have to say the bean's need a lot of help very plain ........ Oh yeah baby's momma say she was happy with her food

A very bad bad service here in this restaurant I stay I at the door for 25 minutes and nobody showed up after he show up he took me to the table so I have to wait another 25 minutes so I said screw this place so I left I said I'm not coming back here no more

We always sit in the bar so we can watch sports, and we always have great service! The food is good, the servers are friendly, and you can accumulate points that you can use towards a meal.  However, don't your account go inactive for 90 days,  your points will disappear

Great Food, Wonderful, Patient, Kind, Sweet Service! From the Hostesses dealing with all the hungry crazy guests, with our even crazier kids, to our heaven sent server Kylie,  I could not be more happy with our experience here tonight. Our food did take long to come out but with a one hour wait to be seated on a busy night that was to be expected.

Placed a simple order with Amanda post rush hour and it was wrong. Salad with no tomatoes and a burger with no mustard. Once I get back to work and open my lunch, tomatoes and mustard, exactly what I didn't want.

Service was horrible and food came out late. Server forgot to bring our our soups so I just told them to take it off the menu. The quality of the food here has really gone downhill and apparently the service has too. The chicken was under cooked so I sent that back too. Manager tried to take care of it but she did take off the raw chicken off the bill and gave me a $5.00 certificate but I gave it back to her and said this will be my last visit. Honestly, she really didn't care to above and beyond to take care of us. I will definitely be sending them the doctors bill is I get sick.

I used to love Chili's, but it seems to have gone downhill over the last few years. The servers are friendly enough, but I've usually sat in the bar where it's "first come, first served." This last visit was very disappointing. I know from past experiences to not order a burger, but with the assurance that they recently revamped their burgers, I ordered one. My dining partner ordered pasta with no tomatoes and requested it be brought out hot off the oven.  The burger was bland with far too many onion crisps and the pasta was already lukewarm plus it came out with tomatoes!  Very disappointing! Would only return if a group was meeting there, not by my own choice.
We had such a great time! The food and adult beverages were amazing! Not only were the staff attentive to our needs but could also answer all of our questions about the menu!

My food seemed fine, nothing that blew my mind or my partners, but the strawberry tea was great. Whilst eating my meal a small child threw up next to me. I was in not phased by this and continued eating me meal as I normally would. The "spill" was cleaned up within 5 minutes and when I went to pay through the Kiosk, my card was declined. Moment later, the manager (forgot his name) came and said the food was complimentary due to the incident and even gave me some "chili bucks" for my next visit. Overall, I had a pleasant time.
I've been to Chili's twice and have loved both times. The service is excellent and the food delicious! I had the sirloin from their light menu,  only 400 calories,  wow! It was sooo good!

I just got done vomiting for the 3rd time... Worst food poisoning I've ever had. My husband called to inform them already. Im laying on a couch sick as a dog writing this review while my family is having a bbq outside. AND the salad tasted about the same coming back up as it did going down. Also service was horrible! The waitress did not understand the definition of her job and left us without checking on us at all. No, it was not crowded or busy. I had to physically get out of my chair to find her talking with a coworker to ask for refills. Never eating here again and I would advice anyone who inquires about this restaurant to do the same.

It's a chain. It's often a hit and miss. I think that's to be expected. They do offer descent lunch break prices that are fair. Sometimes it's nice to eat lunch in a restaurant instead of on your lap from a drive thru. Chili's has surprisingly good chips and salsa and fajitas. (Go figure)It's not local, they have spotty service but they do have an excellent A/C and in Btown cool air is king!

Great time with my family. Had my toddler there did not feel uncomfortable. Our server Oscar was very attentive, and funny. He made some great suggestion that my family enjoyed. I also enjoy the membership points that Chili's gives! I cant wait to go again.

Chilli's is a place I probably would not go to. A friend had given me a gift card so I decided to try Chili's out. I went there today just after they opened at 11:00. At 11:13 my order was taken, both the drink order and a meal from the lunch specials part of the menu. At 11:23 I was given a drink, and by 11:28 there was a bowl of soup placed in front of me. Seriously ten minutes for a drink that is literally 20 feet away. A turtle would have gotten it to me faster! Anyhow more time goes by and at 11:36 another waiter? brings over my cheesburger (barely warm) and fries (room temperature). I informed the waiter that none of my food was hot. He was gracious and apologized, and offered to have the food made again. My lunch "hour" is only 45 minutes, and I did not have time for another 23 minute wait for a cheeseburger and fries. So I just left. If the staff would have delivered the food at like15 to eighteen minutes, it would have been fresh and hot. The food actually looked good, but I guess I won't ever know. Yelp is too kind and sympathetic to the lames, there should be a zero star rating for such crappy service.

Came here for a quick meal on my way back home to California. I ordered what I've always had, which is their cadillac style chicken fajitas and it was fresh and tasty the way food should be. My husband had a fajita chicken salad, which was surprisingly super fresh and very tasty and our waitress was fast, courteous and friendly. Everything seemed to go well until the tail end of our meal when another waitress that was not helping us came up behind our table with an attitude as she started ranting that we couldn't use the outlet plug. She was super rude and my husband and I tried to explain that the hostess is the one who allowed us to use the outlet for our laptop and that we were just leaving anyway. She was obviously angry and kept complaining that it should have not been done etc. She made a huge ass deal and it ruined the wonderful meal we had. I don't mind people explaining and correcting a situation but I will not tolerate someone trying to "scold" me as if I were a child. This is simply unacceptable and people need more training if they are to deal with the public.  In a nutshell I've already made up my mind that I won't be coming back to this Chili's.
Just a typical Chili's. Food and service were about average. Prices are ok. The tables in Chili's always seem so small to me. Big menu.
Their bacon burger sliders are great!! And their onion rings!! Of course the chips and salsa are always amazing!!!

We were here last week and the service was much improved. Not a long wait and the food is good but I did notice the service was much better. We went around 6pm on a Wednesday and our family had salad, chicken strips and a corn dog. It was good and again service was faster and better.
Brian K of Bakersfield loves this place. Obviously he has more taste in his butt then his mouth.  Crappy microwave food and even worse service. How this place stays in business is beyond me.

I had lunch with my family and for the first time in quite a while we were all happily surprised and satisfied.  We waited a little longer than we would have liked to; however,  everything was great. The server was knowledgeable and really new the menu. I hadn't been in a Chili's in quite some time. I will start going there more often

Since Chili's has updated their menu it's just great! Went there last Friday night,  it was a 40 minute wait but we had gift cards so we waited. Our waiter, Jay Pa,  was taking care of a lot of table but he always made sure to check on us and refill our drinks. He was very likeable, too, which made the wait worth it. I ordered the Guacamole burger with a turkey patty, it was beyond delicious, as were the sweet potato fries. My fiancé got a bowl and he loved it. We finished off with the  Skillet Toffee brownie with vanilla ice cream, it was amazing and a great end to an already delicious meal.

Would give this location no stars if I could. Never made it to a table as the dismissive host/waiter who made a minimal effort to seat us finally instructed us to "just go stand by a table in the bar and they'll seat you when they have a chance." no thanks. won't be back.
Service was great perfect drinks and table side Guacamole. Server was Felicity!!! Super friendly. Service was quick and the bottomless salsa was truly bottomless.

Okay I am a regular at this Chilis only because it is close to my work. However after the 20 plus visits in the last 2 months it is really starting to make me wonder why do I keep putting myself through the aggravation of even going. The service 90% of the time is terrible. I order the same thing every time with an hour lunch and it seems to take them  30 minutes to bring me my drink, soup and house salad. Today i ordered my drink in a to go cup and just a bowl of soup it took 40 minutes to get my soup and he brought my drink in regular cup. Now lets say i put my card in the table to let him know i want my receipt since there is no kiosk tablet on this table and no sign of him, let me say by this time i have 15 minutes to get back to work from my lunch break. So still waiting and finally someone else comes by saying would you like to pay? Well duh!! I understand most of the people working here are not career waiters waitresses but please really  how hard is it to screw up a dr pepper in a to go cup and a bowl of potato soup? Really what takes 40 minutes to get these items and let me mind to tell you it was not busy. This is first time even with bad service i didn't leave a tip. I always leave something but today the supposedly two guy who were supposed to be my waiters who i seen maybe total of three time didnt even deserve a tip. They were not even friendly or apologetic foe the delay or screw up.

One of my most favorite places to eat.  Excellent service, great food, and moderately priced!  Nothing beats their enchilada soup! I have never left this place disappointed!  I highly recommend eating here.
The food is mediocre, it's probably  good for an appetizer and drinks sort of night but it does not serve quality food. The service is always bad, always. I avoid this place as much as possible.
Chilies is a great place to eat the food here is delicious! Lots of great items to choose from on their menu and the service is also good! Yum!

Tried to call in an order for about thirty min straight around 830-9pm and was unable to get through to anyone.  After a long day at the hospital with family and looking disheveled i really didnt want to eat anywhere but rather take it home... We went to the to go door and waited for someone who informed us they arent doing the "to go thing" tonight but to wait at the bar and he will take our order.  we went to the bar and waited... nothing, he was pretty busy and didn't have the time.  So out of frustration i called the restaurant over and over while waiting at the bar and watched MULTIPLE waitresses stand around and socialize while letting the phone ring.   We then went to the front where you would regularly walk in and the F*ing hostess was to busy texting to even look up and ask about seating!  I honestly shit you not! there's a picture to go with this.... Anyways we told her we wanted Oscar to place a to go order for us and she said sorry you have to go to the bar and we said no we've been there waiting and once again she said sorry he cant do that.... Then Oscar walked up shook our hands and had our order ready within 5 min and asked if we needed a water while we wait and HE apologized for the nonsense everywhere.   My question is wheres the management?!?!?!!?  Really it's amazing how long the girl at the front was texting and ignoring everyone from customers to her own team members.  Welcome to chilis we like to ignore you until you ask us if you can sit in the EMPTY booths that were everywhere on the restaurant side.  What an Epic fail! OSCAR gets 10 stars but this b.s. tonight deserves none!

Sometimes really really good, other times we leave saying we will never come back again. Bathrooms not clean, I can imagine the kitchen!  chips and salsa are the best. Here's a tip add ranch to salsa for a different flavor which taste great as we'll. some servers are good and others act like they hate their jobs. Also one thing that is completely cheap is their over flow waiting room by the front door. There is no ventilation at all! It's 105 outside and they don't even have a small ac for it. Your not a mom n pop place chilies! Pay a couple thousand and put one in there. It's so tacky not to.

Excellent service and our waitress was nice. Food was really good too, I had the green chili chicken enchiladas and a blackberry tea for lunch. I would come here to watch sports too and drinks with friends..
This restaurant seems like a good idea for a fun time out, however it is all a lie. all that I really need to say is that I can stick my finger through the greasy, soft and mushy chips.

I hadn't been to a Chili's in a while and I was sadly disappointed. I noticed that they no longer offer the half portions on some of the appetizers. I ordered fajitas with Shrimp and Steak minus the rice and beans because the rice & beans have never been good here, I know good rice and beans and this ain't it. Anyhow, I received a "non-sizzling" plate, the shrimp, meat and grilled veggies were merely WARM not hot and definitely not sizzling as you would encounter whenever ordering fajitas. I had approximately a full size onion and bell peppers, 8 shrimps and only 4 slices of steak and for the each you pay a dollar extra? The meat wasn't seasoned very well, the whole ensemble was just BLAH... Disappointment I tell you, it was fairly busy I felt no point in complaining. I've had such awesome experiences all over Bakersfield, this one fell short and definitely not returning when there's so much better here in town. I'm a foodie, I am a damn good cook and so I'm picky...check please

I haven't been here in 3 years because my last visit wasn't very good. So I decided to give this place another shot today. Yet again today's experience was also not well either. Seated fast with fast drinks. Everything else it just went downhill from there. The table larger than us got their food first, and we waited, and waited and waited for our food. So the table after us were almost done eating than we finally got our food. We almost walked out, twice. So we won't be coming back here again for a very long time, yet again..

Burger not anywhere close the temp ordered. The chili itself had some flavor but more soupy than anything.  Generally lousy service before they even got all that busy. When more people came by, yikes. We went here out of a traveling/timing/desperation scenario and were suitably underwhelmed. And everyone was hungry an hour later cause nobody really got satisfied or filled up.
I think of this place like Applebee's..... but slightly crappier food.  Its ok. But thats about it. Insignificant... in almost every way
Sometimes service can be spotty but last night the service was great! Our server went above and beyond. Food was great.

This would be a 5 start review except the server we had was horrible. Food was great the waiter Kyle not so much. Kyle if you read this review you need service training. Your attitude and service is in dire need of help. Please consider working with Oscar for some serious training. Thank you Oscar for pulling Kyle's weight. If anyone is considering a dining experience don't sit in Kyle's section. Bad attitude, never smiles and not friendly. Note (Chili's) please train your servers before you hire them, our experience was not a pleasant one because of Kyle. We will be trying the new Chili's out when it opens. Sorry Rosedale Chili's you lost a repeating customer. Oscar you are a 5 star waiter, Kyle sorry you only deserve 1 star and that's being generous.

Went again last night for dinner using a gift card received on Christmas. We arrived at the restaurant at around 9:30 in the evening; it was nice that we were entertained even at such a late hour. The food was nice and warm. Very quick and efficient service. We ordered a burger and pairing plate, both were yummy, but the taco was okay. Happy with visit, will continue to choose this location for dinner.
Tried to have a nice dinner with my wife and daughter... Unfortunately, that didn't happen. App was forgot about and had to send back two sets of steaks. Ended up leaving. Might not go back.

This place is always packed!!! I don't know why. I had the chicken & steak fajitas. They were good. What sucked is that they only put like a fourth of the meat shown in the picture. I mean they really skimped out on me. I wish I had taken a pic. Had the rice and beans along with my fajitas and both were terrible. Could not eat at all.

Everything went well until my 11 yr old put her left overs in the to go box and a hair under her chicken pasta ewww!!!  20min wait wasn't long the 2X $20's were good also. Service was good just the last part!!!

Worst service ever - especially from the bar. For starters, she took several minutes to greet us (they were not busy). We didn't get any menus or setups. The bar and restaurant didn't close until 10:30 pm - we arrived around 9:00 pm. We ordered 2 Presidente Margaritas - our drinks didn't have any salt so we asked for some. She told us "No, I'm sorry. I have already started packing and cleaning my bar up." So wrong! Anytime we asked for anything (even the basics like water), she rolled her eyes and sighed as if we were bothering her. I have been going to Chilis for over 20 years and I have never had this bad of service! I don't recommend coming here especially for a date, business meeting, or if you care at all about halfway decent service!
Love the chips and salsa. Pretty much all the  appetizers are yummy! Good happy hour deals! Can be quite slow if it is busy, which it is on the weekends! Can't wait for the new location on Gosford!
Bad service, waited 1 1/2 hours to be seated.  Called in 30 minutes in advance and still waited an hour and half.  Let's just say I will not be not be going there again. . Just be prepared to wait!!!

The chips and salsa are good, but such a high volume location needs to really step-up their cleaning game. Also, the food arrived stone cold after a very long wait. Perhaps chain places, like this, need to consider reducing the number of tables to a level they can actually serve with some level of quality.

Decor is cutesy but with a cookie cutter feel. The waitress was nice but overly perky.  She actually drew a heart on the bill in pink highliter. I went with a friend and we ordered the deal where you get two dinners and a shared appetizer for $20.00. We had the half order of Texas cheese fries and they were pretty good with melted cheese, crumbled bacon, and sliced jalapeños and ranch dipping sauce. I ordered the margarita chicken which came with rice and black beans. It wasn't bad, just uninspired; I felt like I could have thrown it together myself at home - without a recipe.  My dinner companion ordered the Cajun chicken pasta. I had several bites, but she expressed it best "It wasn't, (dramatic pause) ba-ad. I'm not saying I'd come back here and have it again, but it was o.k." Let's be honest.  Who really wants to get all dressed up and pay sit down restaurant prices for just ok?   Well... There was that cheerful little pink heart... What I would return for was the chocolate chip paradise pie. It was a warm chewy bar made with coconut, walnuts, and chocolate chips topped with vanilla ice cream, hot fudge and caramel sauce. Yum !  Dinner left me unsatisfied, but dessert really stepped up to the plate and hit a home run.

Never had worse service in my life.  Me and 3 friends just got off work and wanted a beer and an appetizer to go. Chilis is good at that right? They have a whole togo plan worked out. Well shannon, a lil blonde waitress feels the need to let us know how "fucking rude we are to show up 30 mons before closing" and that she cant believe "how people just show up and expect to be served"???? Excuse me but last time i checked you applied to work here and agreed to the food service industry. She not only did this once but on three separate occasions and as well as another waitress did, did not catch her name. We asked for her manager and after the talk with her NOTHING happened. Did not comp anything for us and she didnt even make the waitress come apologize to us.  Ive worked in the food industry in pretty much every position and ive never acted this way towards a customer who was potentially going to give you business and a tip! And oh the cherry on top, she wasnt even serving us. We sat at the bar to make it easy on them and she still acted that way.  Ill never be eating their again.

I haven't been too chill's in a long time. We wanted about 15 or 20 minutes for a table because it was really packed with groups of people which was fine.We sat and got our drinks pretty fast.I ordered a piña colada and it was soooooo good lol  And my husband just got a sprit.we ordered our food and got it in 10 minutes but it was so fresh and really hot still.The waiter was really friendly and refilled or drinks right away,while he still was waiting like 3 other tables.We were very happy about everything so we tipped the waiter better then usual lol !

nice atmosphere, was seated quickly. the servers were really nice. i had a server named Dustin that was full of energy, ontop of everything with a really good attitude and really knowledgable of the menu. nice prices also. ill be coming again.

Three years have passed since this incident and now I have the "server" messaging me saying she doesn't recall any of this (3 years later) and that there's no way it happened and she would never treat anyone like that.  Uh, yeah.  She says she doesn't recall and then says it never happened.  Then she said maybe we were both having a bad day.  I was having a WONDERFUL day seeing my dad for the first time in sooooo long and my daughters seeing him for the first time in 18 months.  And then Ashley came along and treated us horribly, which only bothered me because my dad is eldery and disabled and she was disgusted by him and his shaking and refused to help him.  I seriously feel like crying reliving what an awful horrible person she was and how hard me dad tried not to be embarrassed in from of us because of the way she acted towards him because of his parkinson's. Hey Chili's:  Perhaps you should call your former employee and tell her to leave your customers alone.  We were insulted and offended enough then, and  Chili's never apologized, and no I have this nasty person posting garbage on my page calling me a liar and saying this never happened and at the same time saying it was too far back for her to remember.  Then she said maybe one or both of us was having a bad day (certainly wasn't me as I was so excited to see my dad) as if it's okay to offend an elderly disabled person even if this were true.  Let me assure you that she's the only one that was awful that day.  We gave you our business, paid our bill and were treated like garbage.  I'd arrange a boycott of this location if I could.  In the meantime, TELL YOUR HORRIBLE SERVERS NOT TO HARASS GOOD CUSTOMERS.
Great meal for lunch, enjoyed the new pairings, beef tostada & sour cream chicken enchilada......you can even play game at table....fun afternoon had by all....

I get that it's a chain, but my meal was pretty mediocre. I had the california flatbread pizza... the sauce was a strange taste that I didn't find either appealing or appropriate for pizza... a little sweet and just... odd.  Wouldn't go back. There are much better local spots - i feel like places such as Chili's only stay open because they're a chain and people recognize the name. If it were locally owned, it probably wouldnt survive.

I went there because I was craving their chocolate paradise pie. My coworker and I sat at the bar because the wait was over 30 minutes on a week day during lunch! As soon as we sat down the bartender mentioned how busy she was. We already knew what we wanted and we told her that. She asked us to wait because she still had other customer's orders to take. As we ate our dessert for lunch ;) we watched her put a pitcher under the Blue Moon tap and turn it on. She walked away.  About 5 minutes later she noticed the beer was over flowing the pitcher and flowing down the bar. She ended up wasting the beer by the way. Fail! She finally gave us the check and ran the card, but ran the wrong amount!! She did correct it after I asked her to. Horrible service the entire time we were there. Not worth it.This lady needed to take a quick break to collect herself, shake it off and come back and do her job right. I'm not sure I'll go back.

We ordered the guacamole as a starter and it was great! We ordered chicken enchiladas and they came out cold; the chicken/steak fajita plate had very few pieces and  the chicken resembled clay. I really liked the kiosk at the table. We didn't have to wait for our server to come around with the check.

I've been here a few times with friends and my husband.  I have generally been seated quickly, despite a big crowd.  The atomsphere is loud and noisy- it's definitely a place you could go with a group or kids.  During each occasion, the service has been quick but chilly.  The servers are not very friendly and sometimes laugh at what I choose to order, but they get the job done. I was especially impressed with their ability to always get my order right.  I always have a ton of modifications, and they always bring out what I ask for to a tee.  The presentation of the dishes are appetising and the food tastes good.  Big portions for good prices.  My husband and I walked out, stuffed from our dinner, dessert, and endless drinks- the prices are moderate, and the food seems worth the expense. Overall, good place for American food and a rowdy time with friends.

The wife and I find ourselves here a few times a month, the crew is always friendly,it's always clean, and the kids like the tablet and it's only .99 cents for unlimited games through our stay, the margaritas are amazing my wife gives there patron margarita 5 stars and me aswell for there berry. The food is always perfectly Cooked so many good deals and a vast menu to choose from we rarely get the same app or entree because we like trying everything and so far so good, the reason I didn't give 5 stars is while we dine I order a plate to go, and twice in a row they missed something me giving them the benefit I chose not to check before leaving, the first case was one of the few bacon cheese burgers they have,they have me the wrong one I still ate it and was satisfied with the taste, second was a half rack of ribs with garlic mashers and broccoli, there was no broccoli and French fries rather mashers, ribs were delicious but a bit upsetting

I came here last night with some friends and the food was good but the service was a bit slow. They were really busy in there which is typical on a Friday night. I would have expected a bit more attentiveness from the waitress after having to wait awhile for our table. I will come back because I like chili's but I hope my next experience with the service is better than this time.

I love Chili's, but this place is always slammed. I had a friend that worked here and apparently they are one of the top 3 busiest Chili's in the country (a.k.a be prepared to wait, no matter the time of day). Everyone is familiar with the food offering of Chili's, but my personal favorites are the chips and salsa as well as the fajitas. In order to skip the crowds, I always order my food "to go." Their to-go service is excellent and they always package up everything perfectly (never had food spill on the drive home). I will be a Chili's customer for life...

Quesadilla explosion salad was good, California flatbread was good. Service was a bit slow, but it wasn't our servers fault--you could tell she had a ton of tables for the lunchtime push. I asked for special options to my salad and she (Amanda M)  and the kitchen got them all right. It was fresh and hit the spot. Amanda was the highlight of the meal.

Chili's has always been consistently good.  Family was in from out of town.  We don't have bad attitudes , nor are we loud or rude.  It was the worst experience ever in my lifetime and my family agreed.  We had reservations and that went well.  The waitress seemed fine, better than fine.  She didn't take our order to the kitchen when she took it.  She came back and said she just turned it in.  One family member ordered  something, hold the bacon.  They cannot eat bacon so they couldn't accept it.  (Politely).  The waitress came back and said the manager was re cooking right away but then. It never came to the table.  This family member had waited for 1 1/2 hour and still no food.  Insult to injury, they charged her half price. For starving her  all that time.  They should have  not charged  her  at all.  Her husbands Vegetables were nearly raw and the meat overcooked.   I was totally shocked....that they charged her. A man was with the waitress and it appeared he told her to charge half price as if that was a  good thing.   People don't usually complain anymore they just don't return.          Chili's may be out of business soon.

By far the best restaurant that I've been to in awhile! Our server was Oscar, he didn't linger he was fast efficient and came by often to get my husband more tea (which really helps since he has a lap band). Loved the service, loved the food, and especially loved the fresh pretzels!!! 08/08/2013

Wife and I tried this again after a total disappointment a year ago.  It was about 8:30pm on a Wednesday night,  less than half full, and we had to put our name down and wait anyway. We asked specifically for a table, not a booth. we waited about 20 min and noticing about 15 open tables. Little miss daffy said they had one ready and walked us to a booth. I said we asked for a table, and she then said, oh you wanted a table table. After waiting 20min and seeing several tables and booths open, but I guess they feel like we hadn't worked up an appetite until the 21ST min.  My wife and looked at each other and said screw it and left.  I don't care for people that go out of their way to waste our time.  I would like the opportunity to train these ass monkeys about customer service.  I think the only qualification you need to be a manager there is that at some time you had to sell Direct TV.
Great service, food smoking hot, & well portioned. I'll definitely go back.
Wide selection and variety of  menu options, Texas cheese fries are the bomb! Bar staff generally great ! 1st come 1st served in bar area, grab a table if available and avoid the wait.

My chicken fajitas entree was horrible. Flour tortillas straight out of a package - cold and tasteless. Chicken was not grilled properly. Gave up on the meal after two bites. Waste of money. Avoid this place.

Terrible service. Went out with my girl . We are easy going people but know what to look for as we have both been in food service industry before.  Took a while to be seated which is fine, it was a little busy. Waitress didn't smile no energy . Brought our appetizer and food within 2 minutes of each other . Had to ask another server for refill as lady never checked on us. Waited on Bill after finished almost 10 minutes. never saw waitress  just got tired of waiting, left cash on table and left. Probably will never go back due to experience
Standard Chili's food, which can never go wrong. Tip: call ahead during peak times. There's almost always a wait.

Alright I'm pretty sure everyone has been to Chili's before right? Its true they are all pretty similar. The wait can be epic here and is it really worth an hour wait? So we checked in and went browsing in the near by stores. When we finally got our table the waitress was nice and took our order. The drinks took a little while, but the restaurant was packed. I got the two for twenty deal with my brother, so we got an appetizer to share and each got a main coarse. The guacamole and chips appetizer was pretty tasty. I got the chicken quesadilla salad for my main course. I really liked it only complaint is they put a little bit too much dressing. If the place isn't packed its an alright place to get food, but not really worth waiting an hour over.

Have been there a few times.  The food was okay.  I love the burgers, absolutely delicious but the customer service isn't the greatest.  Was there last night and after ordering a dessert, the waitress never brought it to us and after about 10 minutes brought us our bill.  I didn't want to order the dessert anymore after waiting for it.
A classic place for a decent meal and moderately priced. The kids love it. Always busy at this location but service holds its own.

Just another place in the long line of restaurants that are ok when they FIRST open up then quickly, THEY SUCK. You can KISS IT, Chilis. With your preform corporate food and classic big business impersonalism. You are everything that makes a restaurant suck. Where do you find your cooks? Denny's rejects? How can you NOT cook pre-packaged food? Thank Raytheon for the microwave oven or you'd be out of business. What a joke. Rude wait staff, incompetent cooks, hosts who would rather be ANYWHERE but there. It all comes bursting through in vivid detail the minute you step out of your car. This kid will never be back. I don't know how you stay in business. I guess you are a prime example of "location is everything".  Chilis, YOU SUCK.
The food (soup and salad) was good but the service was quite poor. Once we received our meal we didn't see our server again until it was time for the bill!!

Chili's is a great family dinning environment. The service is great, the bar is wonderful, and my kids can be loud. My favorite is chicken ranch sandwich. Don't for get chips and salsa. Highly recommended to stop by and try it out.

Hands-down this is my FAVORITE place to eat in Bakersfield. I can't even complain about the long lines because their food and service is top-notch. I was most impressed the first time I went. I wish I could remember the waiter's name but he did an amazing job. He's the type that you don't have to ask him for a refill, because he has another one ready for you before you even think to ask. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone :)

At most restaurants the crowds usually die down after the newness wears off.  At this location, which has been open now for about 4 years it is still crowded all of the time.  That says alot about the food and the service.

Yacki is the best server EVER!!! She was so quick amd attentive it was so impressive watching her work!! She was even cleaning chairs on her down time!!! The ranchero tacos are delish!!! The food was great we ended up with a lot leftovers. The white spinach queso dip is was filled us up!!! Man o man was it good! All around great experience!

I am giving Chilis on Rosedale Hwy a one star for the appetizers. However, The service at this location is a no star. Apparently the manager "cannot assume a 4 year old," who is asking her if they serve pancakes here, "would expect to have syrup with her waffles"... But the manager did assume everyone eats like "her family members, who do not use syrup with either pancakes or waffles." This was her way of apologizing. And The waitress should be sent somewhere to learn customer service with a smile. I couldn't even get a refill on a water until my meal was nearly done. I will never return to this restaurant. And to end this review, the waffles taste rotten.

Often times we come here because they have awesome coupons where both my boys get free meals if my husband and I both order an entrée. It's also conveniently located near our home. So, if we're in a pinch, we can get here pretty quickly. I also like that they have call ahead seating. We usually don't need call ahead seating because we eat earlier than most.  I'm not too impressed with their menu options. I love getting their Triple Dipper. I usually order it with Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers and two orders of Southwestern Egg Rolls. If you haven't tried either of those items, it's a must! Because of their coupon, I usually get the Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers meal with broccoli and loaded mashed potatoes. That's about where my meal selection ends. Like I said, I'm not too impressed with their menu options.  Although we have great service every time we come and we enjoy whatever we eat, Chili's is usually not our favorite or first choice. But, we go when we are in a pinch with our handy coupons and that makes it all worth it. I don't think we'd ever go and pay full price.

This is one of our standard go to restaurants with or without the kids. Food is consistently good. Service is pretty good most of the time. And the ambiance is ok if you don't mind it getting loud from time to time.  With that said I have to give Dustin 2 very enthusiastic thumbs up on tonight's service. He was on top of everything. Always making sure drinks were filled, checking to make sure appetizers and meal were satisfactory. We had our 3 kids with us and he interacted with them very politely and even made our 7 yr daughter smile. Thank you again for the wonderful service Dustin. Keep up the awesome work.

Okay y'all... so there's this waiter Lady that apparently doesn't have any nerve endings in her hand... and also doesn't warn you when a plate is hot.........almost burnt my whole fricking hand off. Sherbet out y'all.

Meh, I should have found a restaurant with a patio on such a nice day but wanted to try out a Chili's.  Went to sit in the bar section. It was messy/dirty and reeked of old draft beer. Service was so-so. I did like the lunch special options. For $7 I ordered a salad and quesadilla that came with fries. The salad was small and served warm. Nothing to get excited about. The fries were tasty but cold. The quesadilla was the star - get the smoky chicken one! This alone gets a star. I had to ask for several basic things that I should not have had to ask for. Affordable for lunch but there are better options out there re food and service.
Whatever you do don't eat the chicken strips and fries I had it last night after my sisters graduation and now I'm calling into work for having the runs and throwing up smh

It's usually pretty busy during the normal dinner rush. Nothing too impressive here, it's simply an ok place for food. Service is mediocre, waiters/waitresses take a bit longer than I would like for drink orders. I usually have an idea of what I want to order but trying to flag down your server to order isn't the easiest. Overall this place is just ok, nothing fancy.
I must say every I have came to chili's the food was great the service was great only complaint was I i ordered my steak medium well and It was well done but was still very moist and delicious.

One of the best chips and salsas anywhere. We never have bad service there since this place has opened. The bew renovations are nice but it takes away from the restaurant feel. Its like they are trying to make it as if you were eating at home but at a house with little room and too many people.  The service is very quick and the keep the drinks coming which is always a key part to great service. Its usually busy but its clean and the food is good.  For a chain they have a great version of Tex-Mex and it will always be a go to place for us with the kids.
Love their appetizers!!! Entrees are a hit or miss !! Desserts are absolutely delicious !!!

The servers are always nice and do their jobs well. The cooks need to do better on the food as our medium steak was well done and the onion rings were too well done. The kids mashed potatoes my child refused to eat and when hubby tasted them they were just gross and super thick. The men's bathroom according to my husband was disgusting and smelled like a stadium bathroom where everyone went at the same time.. yuck!

Everything good especially service was a little surprised to be charged for sour cream but I guess that's soon to be the new normal in California. The wife loved her burger the bun was especially good. Over all good place to eat.

Wanted to start by saying that my servers ( Jacob and Jr.) Were amazing!!!!! I will tell u that the food was ok.  But the service will take me back.  Jacob was one of the best servers I have ever had.  Thank u Jacob for the great service! Made me feel like he knew me. Thats the way it should be when u go out to eat!

I have been here several times and the service is consistently terrible. The hostess spends entirely too much time socializing instead of seating patrons. An entire section of the restaurant wasn't even open and we were finally seated there after a forty five minute wait. We were initially told it would be a 20 minute wait. The manager redeemed herself by resolving to speak with the employee and seating us quickly and assigning a decent server. Although we were given dirty silverware because the server was so busy cleaning up a huge party next to us that she probably had someone else grab the food who wasn't careful. She was extremely embarrassed.  The food and margaritas are good. It's enough to go back one more time, with some coupons. Their loyalty club is pretty good. It makes up for the service.

This was a first for us. It must be fallout from the recent presidential election. The hispanic woman bartender deliberately served customers of her race who arrived after us before serving us. We waited patiently and almost left when another server noticed what was going on and stepped in to take our order. Amazing to see this kind of treatment happen in a national chain like Chilis. She should be fired.

2 for $20 deal is a LOT of food esp if you get the chips and guac appetizer. It came with amazing salsa; I boxed the leftover LOL. Had the 6oz sirloin steak cooked to medium. Super yummy. Also had the house salad, was meh 3/5. Could use yummier croutons and more cucumber and onion.  BF got the bacon burger. I had that the last time I came here. It's yummy and I love their garlicky pickles. Very friendly hostess. Server seemed very tired and we did have to wait a while to be able to request takeout boxes.

Love this place! It's great for a chain restaurant in Bakersfield. We always sit at the bar and have appetizers. Their steak nachos are terrific and the service is always great by any of the bartenders we have had. It's even better when visiting on a Sunday because all appetizers are half but make sure you get there early.
I only dined here because I had a gift card. The service was good but the food tasted like glorified TV dinners. I won't be back.

Let me start by saying we enjoy Chili's and will continue to go there. However,  a practice that we have experienced at happy hour is something everyone should be aware of.  When ordering a well drink on the happy hour menu make sure you check your tab to get the correct price. Frequently, instead of being charged the correct amout we have been charged $1 more per drink.  When brought to the server's attention we have been told "oh, we gave you a double" or "we gave you a better liquor" even though we hadn't asked for either and specifically ordered the happy hour well drink. Just be cautious!
